Raw RNA-seq data were processed using standard quality control pipelines to remove low-quality reads and adapter sequences
Differential gene expression was assessed using DESeq2 with a false discovery rate threshold of 0.05
Read counts underwent normalization to account for library size differences and compositional biases across samples
The gene expression matrix was constructed from aligned BAM files using featureCounts with default parameters
We employed edgeR to identify significantly differentially expressed genes between treatment and control conditions
A count matrix was generated by aggregating reads mapped to each gene across all samples in the experiment
Quality control metrics including read depth, mapping rates, and GC content were evaluated for each sample
Single-cell RNA sequencing data were analyzed using Seurat for dimensionality reduction and cell type identification
Batch correction was applied to remove technical variation introduced by different sequencing runs using ComBat
Sequencing reads were subjected to alignment against the reference genome using STAR aligner with default parameters
Gene expression levels were quantified as FPKM values to enable comparison across different transcript lengths
Hierarchical clustering was performed on normalized expression data to identify groups of co-expressed genes
The limma package was utilized for linear modeling of microarray data to detect differential expression
Transcript abundance was estimated using kallisto in pseudoalignment mode with 100 bootstrap samples
Principal component analysis was conducted to visualize sample relationships and identify major sources of variation
Gene set enrichment analysis revealed significant overrepresentation of immune response pathways in the upregulated genes
Adapter sequences and low-quality bases were removed through trimming using Trimmomatic with a quality score threshold of 20
Aligned BAM files were sorted and indexed using samtools before downstream quantification analysis
Pseudobulk analysis was performed by aggregating single-cell counts within each cell type and condition
An MA plot was generated to visualize the relationship between average expression and log fold change for all genes
A volcano plot was created to display statistical significance versus fold change for differential expression results
Alternative splicing events were detected using rMATS to identify differential exon usage between conditions
Transcript-level quantification was performed using kallisto with the reference transcriptome index
Gene-level read counts were obtained using featureCounts from the Subread package with strand-specific counting
RNA-seq reads were aligned to the reference genome using STAR with two-pass mode for improved accuracy
BAM file processing including sorting, indexing, and filtering was carried out using samtools version 1.9
Quality filtering and adapter removal were performed using Trimmomatic with sliding window quality trimming
ComBat was applied to adjust for batch effects while preserving biological variation in the expression data
Expression values were normalized to TPM to account for transcript length and sequencing depth differences
UMAP dimensionality reduction was applied to visualize high-dimensional single-cell data in two dimensions
t-SNE was used for non-linear dimensionality reduction to identify distinct cell populations in the dataset
Cell type annotation was performed by comparing marker gene expression patterns against reference databases
Pseudotime analysis was conducted using Monocle3 to infer developmental trajectories from single-cell data
Trajectory inference revealed the progression of cell states along the differentiation pathway
Differential abundance testing was performed to identify cell types that changed significantly between conditions
Marker genes for each cluster were identified by comparing expression levels within clusters versus all other cells
Normalized counts were used for downstream statistical analysis to ensure comparability across samples
Log transformation was applied to expression values to stabilize variance and improve normality assumptions
Variance stabilization transformation was performed using the DESeq2 vst function prior to visualization
